channel.title: India News, India News Live and Breaking News Today | Hindustan Times
channel.description: India News - Find Latest India News and Breaking News today from India on Politics, Business, Entertainment, Technology, Sports, Lifestyle and more at Hindustan Times.
channel.copyright: Copyright (C) 2019 HT Media Limited. All Rights Reserved.

image.title: India News, India News Live and Breaking News Today | Hindustan Times

item.title: BBC reacts to income tax 'survey' at Delhi, Mumbai offices: ‘We hope to have…’
item.description: The Income Tax Department on Tuesday conducted a survey operation at the BBC's offices in Delhi and Mumbai as part of an investigation into alleged tax evasion.

item.title: PAN to become ‘inoperative’ if not linked to Aadhaar before March 31. Follow steps to link
item.description: From April 1, PAN will be inoperative if not linked to Aadhaar.

item.title: Amid I-T ‘survey’ on BBC, Mahua Moitra's ‘Valentine Day’ dig at govt, Adani
item.description: Income Tax department officials were at the BBC's bureaus in New Delhi and Mumbai, the British broadcaster said, weeks after the government came down hard against a BBC documentary critical of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's role in the 2002 Gujarat riots.

item.title: ‘Ideological emergency’: Opposition attacks Centre for BBC ‘survey’, BJP rebuts
item.description: The visit comes less than a month after BBC's two-part documentary on the 2002 Gujarat riots, which was released outside India and dismissed as “propaganda” by the Indian government.

item.title: HAL in talks with four countries to export Tejas fighter jets
item.description: India's state-owned Hindustan Aeronautics Limited is in talks with at least four countries to sell its light-combat aircraft, the company's top executive said on Tuesday, as New Delhi looks to triple defence exports over the next two years.

item.title: Cash for verdict allegations: Kerala HC directs advocate to cooperate with probe
item.description: Kidangoor has moved the high court seeking an order to prevent his arrest but it was sidelined by justice Kauser Edappagath who refused to pass any interim order

item.title: ‘Agree to JPC probe’: Jairam Ramesh on Amit Shah’s ‘nothing to hide’ remark
item.description: Jairam Ramesh stressed that the Congress was in favour of liberalisation, but this should be on the basis of rules and institutions which should function independently

item.title: BBC means ‘Bhrasht Bakwas Corporation’: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia amid income tax 'survey'
item.description: BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia addressed the media on the tax survey at BBC's Delhi and Mumbai offices.

item.title: Student dies by suicide in IIT-Madras, another rescued: Police
item.description: Police said his friends had sought help as the boy did not open his hostel room and was nowhere to be found on the campus

item.title: ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ needs private sector, not bureaucracy, to soar
item.description: In spite of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s relentless efforts, the military-civilian bureaucracy is protecting its own fiefdom and is still sitting on allowing majority stake to private entities in a joint venture with defence PSUs.

item.title: BJP MP slams Cong's ‘undeclared emergency’ jibe over I-T surveys at BBC offices
item.description: On Tuesday, teams from the Income Tax department were at the BBC office in New Delhi and the BBC studios in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex. The BBC's main office in Mumbai is in Bandra (West). An income tax official told HT that it is a survey and not a raid.

item.title: Congress alleges Rahul's plane denied landing in Varanasi, officials rebut
item.description: Congress alleged that the BJP government is “scared” of Rahul Gandhi.

item.title: Income Tax department conducts ‘survey’ at BBC offices in Delhi, Mumbai
item.description: The Union government on January 20 issued directions for blocking multiple YouTube videos and Twitter posts with links to a BBC documentary based on the 2002 Gujarat riots

item.title: Delhi-Mumbai Expressway: Toll tax to be collected from midnight. Check list
item.description: The price has been fixed based on the distance and it will be charged from midnight of February 14 and 15.

item.title: Has your Aadhaar data been misused? Follow these steps to check
item.description: What if your Aadhaar number is being misused? How do you check it?

item.title: Afternoon brief: Foreign secretary Vinay Kwatra on 2-day Bangladesh visit from tomorrow, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: India doesn't deal with threats using ‘neo-colonial paradigms’: Rajnath Singh
item.description: In an address to his counterparts from various countries at Aero India here, Singh also called for united efforts to counter pressing security challenges, including the threat of terrorism.

item.title: On allegations of erasing Mughal history, Shah says, 'Contributions are not ignored'
item.description: Union home minister Amit Shah's remarks came in response to allegations that the BJP is attempting to rewrite the country's history in which the BJP-ruled states have renamed or are planning to rename cities whose names are associated with Mughal history.

item.title: Foreign secretary Vinay Kwatra on two-day visit to Bangladesh from Feb 15
item.description: Kwatra will travel to Dhaka at the invitation of his Bangladesh counterpart Masud Bin Momen, the external affairs ministry said on Tuesday

item.title: ‘No comparison…’: Amit Shah separates family politics of BJP from other parties
item.description: Home Minister said that his party doesn't raise the second or third generation politicians to the position of a president or give a particular family the positions of power, unlike other parties.

item.title: On Lok Sabha elections, BJP's position on Adani and G20: Amit Shah's top excerpts
item.description: Home minister Amit Shah took a swipe at the Congress and its leader Rahul Gandhi, saying that the BJP will show its strength and that the country will decide the 'principal opposition party to the BJP' in the 2024 polls.

item.title: On Pulwama attack anniversary, Digvijaya slams govt for ‘blatant intelligence failure’
item.description: On Feb 14, 2019, as many as 40 jawans of the CRPF were martyred in a terror attack carried out by the Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM).

item.title: On row over expunging of Rahul Gandhi's speech, Amit Shah says...
item.description: Amit Shah ANI interview: Parts of Rahul Gandhi's and Mallikarjun Kharge's speeches were cut out for 'unparliamentary language', prompting a big row between the BJP and Congress.

item.title: ‘They're after Modi since 2002': Shah on BBC documentary row, Hindenburg report
item.description: The Modi government cracked down on the BBC documentary ‘India: The Modi Question’, ordering social media platforms Twitter and YouTube to delete tweets and videos sharing the film which it describes as a ‘propaganda piece’.

item.title: Concession in education, health to children of martyred soldiers: Centre
item.description: In a reply provided in Rajya Sabha, minister of state (MoS) of defense Ajay Bhatt said the government assures full reimbursement of the tuition fee of the child of a martyred soldier

item.title: 'Court to humaare kabze mein...': Shah on opposition claims of CBI, ED 'misuse'
item.description: Amit Shah ANI interview: The union home minister spoke to news agency ANI two days before voting in Tripura.

item.title: PM Modi removed ‘mann ki doori’ of Northeast: Amit Shah ahead of assembly polls
item.description: In an exclusive interview with the news agency ANI, Shah said the PM Modi government has done a lot change the region, including the strengthening of local languages and identities.

item.title: Tripura elections: 'Before 12 pm on counting day...' - Shah's bold prediction
item.description: The BJP created a record in 2018 by ousting the Left Front government which ruled Tripura for 35 years from 1978. The state will go to the polls on February 16 for its 60-member assembly.

item.title: 'Nothing to hide...': Amit Shah on Cong allegations that BJP 'favours' Adani
item.description: A massive political showdown has erupted between the Modi government and the opposition over the latest Hindenburg report on Adani Group. Congress MP Rahul Gandhi had accused the Centre of giving favours to the business conglomerate.

item.title: No competition for BJP in 2024, PM Modi has full support, Amit Shah asserts
item.description: Union home minister Amit Shah said that the people of the country will decide about the principal opposition party to BJP in the 2024 polls and they have not given this label to any party.

item.title: Aero India 2023: Rajnath Singh to host defence ministers conclave
item.description: In a statement, the defence ministry said ministers of foreign-friendly countries and India will engage in carrying forward Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s ‘Make in India, Make for the World’ vision

item.title: Morning brief: JAP chief Pappu Yadav's convoy meets with horrific accident, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: Inform steps taken against ‘evil of unlicensed weapons’: SC to UP govt
item.description: The court made the observations while reviewing a bail petition of a man who killed a person with another co-accused by firing indiscriminately using an unlicensed weapon

item.title: ‘Valorous heroes’: PM Modi pays tributes on Pulwama attack's 4th anniversary
item.description: Pulwama terror attack: On this day in 2019, at least 40 CRPF jawans lost their lives after a suicide bomber drove a car laden with explosives into the security force convoy. The attack was carried out by Pakistani terror group Jaish-e-Mohammed, which is led by Masood Azhar based in Bahawalpur.

item.title: LIVE: IT department conducts survey in BBC's Delhi office
item.description: Breaking news February 14, 2023: Get latest news, breaking news, latest updates, live news, top headlines, breaking business news and top news of the hour.

item.title: Gujarat doctor names BJP MP in suicide note, police say investigation on
item.description: The doctor was found dead at his residence in Veraval on Sunday. He stayed in the same building where he ran a hospital and his body was found by his staff.

item.title: Gang loots four ATMs, decamps with over ₹70 lakh in TN
item.description: During the preliminary investigation, police found that the gang is from the same region as another group of burglars involved in targeting ATMs to loot money during June and July, 2021 in Chennai, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Puducherry and other districts, a police official in the know of the matter said.

item.title: Rahul attacks PM Modi over Parliament ruckus, Adani
item.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi over allegations of fraud by the Adani Group, asking how references at the embattled tycoon made in a parliamentary speech could be seen as an insult to the prime minister.

item.title: First case lodged under Uttarakhand anti-copying law
item.description: A first case under Uttarakhand’s new anti-copying law was registered in Uttarkashi district accusing a man, some unidentified aspirants and a news portal of “spreading misinformation” about the question paper of revenue sub-inspector (Patwari/Lekhpal) exam

item.title: E-courts to stay, can’t depend on likings of HC chief justices: Supreme Court
item.description: Technology as an enabler of open court philosophy and access to justice “is here to stay” and cannot depend on the liking of the high court chief justices, the Supreme Court emphasised on Monday.

item.title: Punjab governor, CM spar over principals’ selection for foreign trip
item.description: Chandigarh: The ongoing tussle between Punjab governor Banwarilal Purohit and chief minister Bhagwant Mann escalated on Monday, with the former questioning a state government appointment and the selection of school principals for a training trip to Singapore

item.title: T’gana’s public debt has risen fourfold since 2014
item.description: The state had an outstanding public debt of ₹75,577 crore as on June 2, 2014 when Telangana was formed as the AP Reorganisation Act came into effect.

item.title: Renault-Nissan sign pact worth ₹5300 cr with TN govt
item.description: An initial investment of around $600 million USD ( ₹5,300 crore) is planned to support the new projects, which will create 2,000 new additional jobs at the Renault Nissan Technology & Business Centre in Chennai, said one of the official.

item.title: Jagan: YSRCP to launch public outreach campaign in Andhra from March 18 to 26
item.description: Andhra Pradesh chief minister Y S Jagan Mohan Reddy on Monday said that the party will be launching a state-wide public outreach programme, from March 18 to 26 to take the achievements of the state government to every doorstep

item.title: Leaders rubbish claims of LTTE chief being alive
item.description: Tamil nationalist leader Pazha Nedumaran’s claim that Velupillai Prabhakaran, the founding chief of the Liberation of Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE), is still alive was quashed by Tamil nationalists and the Sri Lankan army

item.title: Romeo, Julie tale: NDRF dogs help find survivors in Turkey
item.description: On February 8, Romeo and Julie (minus the T) teamed up to rescue a six-year-old girl who had been trapped under debris for more than 72-hours in the Beren area of Gazianep city, Turkey.

item.title: Only double engine govt can usher more development in Tripura: PM Modi
item.description: PM Narendra Modi lashed out at the Left-Congress alliance, saying that they had only worked to fill their own coffers at the expense of the people

item.title: Adani issue: Govt okay with proposal on regulatory panel, Supreme Court told
item.description: India’s Union government on Monday agreed to the Supreme Court’s suggestion of setting up an expert committee to strengthen its supervisory regime after a report by US firm Hindenburg Research against the Adani Group led to a massive slide in the conglomerate’s stock prices.

item.title: Parliament: First part of Budget session ends amid ruckus, to resume in March
item.description: The session will resume on March 13 after a month-long break to allow the standing committees to scrutinise the Budget proposals of the respective ministries.

item.title: After Joshimath crisis, environmental safeguards key in Centre’s SOPs
item.description: New Delhi A month after rapid sliding of land was reported in large parts of Joshimath town leading to the development of cracks in hundreds of homes and other structures, the Union environment ministry has issued a standard operating procedure (SOP) for all highway projects near border areas that emphasises environmental safeguards such as landslide and disaster management, precautions to be taken during tunnelling or drilling, and the protection of river catchments and hydrology

item.title: Retail inflation shoots up to 3-month high of 6.5% in Jan as food prices bite
item.description: High cereal and protein prices pushed India’s retail inflation beyond RBI’s tolerance zone once again in January , with the headline Consumer Price Index (CPI) print coming in at 6

item.title: Lithium Rush: The discovery and the difficulties
item.description: Lithium is often described as the white gold of energy storage technology; light and compact, it is the defining element in the lithium-ion batteries that drive our mobile phones, laptops and, in some cases, electric cars

item.title: Delimitation of J&K seats affirmed by SC
item.description: The decision of the court came on a petition filed by two Srinagar residents who had challenged the March 6, 2020 order without challenging the Presidential order bifurcating the state into two union territories or the J&K Reorganisation Act.

item.title: Modi opens Aero India, says New India like a fighter pilot
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday inaugurated Asia’s biggest military airshow, Aero India 2023, and likened New India to a fighter pilot who “thinks fast, thinks far and takes quick decisions” while addressing a packed audience at the Yelahanka airbase even as he highlighted the potential of Aatmanirbhar Bharat and how the country’s quest for self-reliance had unlocked “new alternatives and opportunities” for the world

item.title: HT This Day: February 14, 1947 -- Classless society and religious freedom
item.description: Mahatma Gandhi in his usual post-prayer speech here yesterday visualized an independent India of a casteless and classless people living together with full cultural and religious freedom

item.title: Odisha cabinet nod to amend family pension rule in favour of trans gender child
item.description: The Odisha government’s move to amend the pension rules come nine months after the Orissa high court ordered payment of family pension to a transperson

item.title: 'Drone view of...': Anand Mahindra shares video of Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway
item.description: The expressway from Kengeri to Mysuru is aimed to reduce the present journey of 3.5 hours to just 1.5 hours. The Rs. 8,453 crore project is scheduled to be inaugurated in March.

item.title: US Air Force's F-35 jets make historic debut at Aero India 2023
item.description: India was earlier planning to co-develop a stealth fighter with Russia, but the proposed multi-billion dollar fifth-generation fighter aircraft (FGFA) project was abandoned after IAF expressed strong reservations about the project due to the high cost and issues related to technology transfer

item.title: 'Red card to chanda (donation), jhanda (flag) wala': PM Modi ahead of Tripura poll
item.description: Narendra Modi launched a scathing attack on the Left-Congress alliance in the assembly election-bound state saying they are “wrestling in Kerala and allying in Tripura”.

item.title: Daily brief: Ashok Gehlot counters PM Modi over budget gaffe dig, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: On visit to Kathmandu, foreign secy Vinay Kwatra reviews India-Nepal partnership
item.description: Foreign secretaries of the two countries “reviewed the wide-ranging India-Nepal partnership and agreed to further strengthen their economic and development cooperation

item.title: Lord Hanuman gets notice from railways over ‘encroachment’. What happened next
item.description: The notice also states that the amount spent on the demolition of structures built on encroached land will be recovered from Lord Hanuman.

item.title: As Kamal Nath meets Bageshwar Dham’s Dhirendra Shastri, BJP takes a swipe
item.description: Senior MP Congress leaders said that Kamal Nath prayed at the temple for the party’s victory in the assembly elections expected to be held in late 2023.

item.title: Ashok Gehlot's ‘offer’ to Modi a day after PM taunts over Rajasthan Budget gaffe
item.description: Speaking to news agency PTI, Gehlot said he rectified his mistake within “34 seconds”, and claimed that the BJP is rattled by his government’s performance in the state that goes to the polls this year-end.

item.title: India important voice in efforts to end Ukraine war: German security advisor
item.description: India has so far refrained from publicly criticising the Russian invasion, but Prime Minister Narendra Modi told President Vladimir Putin during a meeting last year that “today’s era is not of war”

item.title: 'PM Modi's hands were shaking and…': In Wayanad, Rahul Gandhi rakes up Adani issue
item.description: Rahul Gandhi questioned why parts of his speech in Parliament during the budget session were removed, but no words were expunged from Narendra Modi's speech in which he allegedly insulted the Congress leader.

item.title: New India thinks fast, takes quick decisions: PM Modi at Aero India 2023
item.description: The participants at the 14 edition of the biennial airshow included over 800 defence firms, representatives of around 100 foreign nations, 32 defence ministers, air chiefs of 29 air forces and 73 CEOs of foreign and Indian original equipment manufacturers

item.title: JeM terrorist arrested in Pulwama, 25 hand grenades recovered: Police
item.description: Acting on a tip off regarding delivery of consignment in Pulwama, a team was of police and army (55RR) was formed to nab the accused

item.title: ‘…In front of my eyes': Top Jain monk over Muslim body chief's ‘Om-Allah’ remark
item.description: Maulana Arshad Madani stoked a controversy when he claimed that "Om" and "Allah" were the same God worshipped by 'Manu', drawing objections from other religious leaders.

item.title: ‘Defence expenditure rising in absolute terms’: Govt responds to Kharge in LS
item.description: In the union budget, the government had allocated ₹2.95 lakh crore to defence forces which is estimated to be around 1.58% of the country’s GDP.

item.title: 1.12 lakh daily wage earners committed suicide in 2019-21: Centre to Lok Sabha
item.description: Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav said 66,912 housewives, 53,661 self-employed persons, 43,420 salaried persons and 43,385 unemployed persons also committed suicide during the period.

item.title: Govt wants to ensure no one falls behind in development: Prez Droupadi Murmu
item.description: President Droupadi Murmu said the government wants to ensure that no section of the society falls behind in development and that everyone progresses.

item.title: Telangana 2023-24 budget session held only for 7 days, shortest ever
item.description: According to the bulletin issued by state legislature secretary V Narasimhacharyulu, the assembly sat for 56 hours and 25 minutes in a span of seven days, including the question hour and discussions on grants for various departments

item.title: Influencer Shraddha Jain's 'dazy' experience on meeting PM Modi | Watch
item.description: The meeting between the two was on the sidelines of the Aero India 2023 show at Bengaluru, which Modi inaugurated earlier in the day.

item.title: ‘SpiceJet was sent notice for poor safety oversight’
item.description: Minister of state for civil aviation VK Singh said DGCA’s July 27 order last year restricted the number of SpiceJet’s departures to 50% of those approved under the summer scheduled 2022

item.title: Evening brief: Ruckus in Bengal assembly after Suvendu's speech, Mamata Banerjee slams BJP, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: IUML leader says Kerala transman, who gave birth last week was a woman
item.description: Ziya Paval had recently announced partner Zahhad's pregnancy, claiming that this was the first trans-man's pregnancy in India. The couple was blessed with a baby in a Kerala on February 8.

item.title: Hindenburg-Adani row: Centre agrees to committee set up by SC to strengthen regulatory regime
item.description: Hindenburg-Adani row: The Supreme Court asked the Centre to submit a note on the proposed terms of reference by Wednesday. The next hearing will be on Friday.

item.title: Number Theory: Is an early start to summer likely this year?
item.description: On February 10, Delhi’s Safdarjung weather station recorded a maximum of 29

item.title: NSE co-location case: SC refuses CBI challenge to Chitra Ramkrishna bail
item.description: Chitra Ramkrishna last week also secured bail in a money laundering case related to phone tapping allegations; that case was filed by the Enforcement Directorate.

item.title: Vodafone tried to convince Jet Airways CEO who wanted to move on from its services. Here's what happened
item.description: Sanjiv Kapoor was exasperated that despite being told the operator cannot convince him, customer representatives would not stop calling him.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi meets family of tribal man found dead near Kozhikode hospital
item.description: On Thursday (February 9), the hospital staff and security allegedly beat up Vishwanathan accusing him of stealing from the bystanders

item.title: On camera: In UP's Meerut, truck drags car for 3 km; driver arrested
item.description: All four people travelling in the car jumped out in time and escaped any injury.

item.title: How to update photo in Aadhaar card? Follow these steps
item.description: Once the Aadhaar data is updated, you can download an e-Aadhaar or digital copy of the Aadhaar card from UIDAI website.

item.title: Tipra Motha grabs attention in Tripura’s 3-cornered poll contest
item.description: The BJP and Congress tried to ally with Tipra Motha but it chose to contest alone after failing to get any concrete assurances over a separate Greater Tipraland state.

item.title: India rejuvenated defence production sector in 8-9 years: PM Modi at Aero India
item.description: Aero India 2023: PM Modi said India's defence exports have increased six times in the last five years and that it has crossed the figure of USD 1.5 billion in its exports.

item.title: Afternoon brief: Tripura CM predicts ‘tsunami’ for BJP in poll-bound state, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: EAM Jaishankar to visit Fiji, Australia
item.description: Jaishankar will jointly inaugurate the World Hindi Conference with Fiji Prime Minister Sitiveni Rembuka on February 15

item.title: Warming Up To Frozen Food
item.description: Thaw, heat, eat and repeat is the new convenience. The frozen ready-to-eat (RTE) food segment in India has become hot, and new brands are entering the space to tap the growing demand.

item.title: SC affirms validity of exercise for redrawing J&K poll constituencies
item.description: A bench of justices Sanjay Kishan Kaul and AS Oka dismissed petitions of Srinagar residents who challenged the legality of the constitution of the delimitation commission and the subsequent process

item.title: Tripura election: 'Something like a tsunami...' - CM Manik Saha's prediction
item.description: Tripura 2023 election: In 2018 the BJP contested 51 seats and its ally, the Indigenous People's Front of Tripura (IPFT), nine; this time the BJP has taken 55 and given the IPFT five.

item.title: Supreme Court dismisses challenge to delimitation in Jammu & Kashmir
item.description: BREAKING: Supreme Court dismisses challenge to delimitation of assembly, parliamentary seats in J&K.

item.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned till March 13 after sloganeering by opposition MPs
item.description: Opposition MPs Raghav Chaddha, Sanjay Singh, Imran Pratapgarhi, Shakti Singh Gohil, Sandeep Pathak and Kumar Ketkar among the others warned by the Chair for entering the well of the House today.

item.title: 'Shameless...': Mahua Moitra slams Centre after ex-SC judge becomes governor
item.description: A major controversy has erupted over the appointment of Justice Nazeer within 40 days of his retirement. He was a part of the five-judge bench dealing with politically sensitive cases including Ayodhya dispute, triple talaq and demonetisation.

item.title: Two new Supreme Court judges take oath, top court at full strength of 34
item.description: President Droupadi Murmu has signed the warrants of appointment of Justices Rajesh Bindal and Justice Aravind Kumar to the Supreme Court.

item.title: Aero India 2023: PM Modi releases special stamps
item.description: Aero India 2023: Addressing the inaugural event, PM Modi said the sky of Bengaluru is a witness to the capability of New India.

item.title: 'Trust of the world in India has increased': PM Modi at Aero India 2023
item.description: Aero India 2023: PM Modi said Aero India is an example of the expanding capabilities of India.

item.title: Budget session highlights: Rajya Sabha, Lok Sabha adjourned; to meet again on March 13
item.description: Parliament budget session 2023 highlights: The budget session began on Jan 31. The second and final part of the session is scheduled to conclude on April 6.

item.title: ‘Keep brightening lives..’: PM Modi on World Radio Day 2023
item.description: The Prime Minister also asked people to share their inputs for the 98th edition of his monthly "Mann ki Baat" broadcast.

item.title: Morning brief: Weather agency's prediction for spring in North India; and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: New Covid rules from today for flyers to India from these countries: Top points
item.description: As Covid-19 cases have been on a sharp decline worldwide, the Centre has also removed the mandate to upload the 'Air Suvidha' form.

item.title: 4.3 magnitude earthquake strikes Sikkim's Yuksom
item.description: The earthquake took place at around 4.15 am.

item.title: ‘Got an offer in jail, but I didn't compromise': Anil Deshmukh
item.description: Deshmukh, who was arrested in November 2021 and was released on December 28 last year on bail, was speaking at the state-level Conference of Collective Forest Rights.

item.title: Breaking: Retail inflation rises to 3-month high of 6.52% in January
item.description: Breaking news February 13, 2023: Get latest news, breaking news, latest updates, live news, top headlines, breaking business news and top news of the hour.

item.title: Manmohan did better job than Modi, say KCR; BJP hits back
item.description: Replying to the debate on the Appropriation Bill in the state assembly on the last day of the state budget session, KCR, as the chief minister is known, said “Modi proved to be the most inefficient Prime Minister the country had ever witnessed”.

item.title: Govt employees seek old pension plan as promised by Jagan before polls
item.description: He said though there was no official communication to the state from the Centre, there were inquiries from Delhi about the GPS, which they found “is interesting” and needs to be studied in detail.

item.title: ‘A geopolitical necessity’: UK minister on defence partnership with India
item.description: Lucknow: India-United Kingdom defence partnership is a geopolitical necessity, British minister of state for defence procurement Alex Chalk said at the Uttar Pradesh Global Investors Summit on Sunday, as chief minister Yogi Adityanath assured UK investors of full cooperation from his government

item.title: Guv: Atrocities against Dalits still prevalent in Tamil Nadu
item.description: The governor also described BR Ambedkar as a nationalist who, he said, is being used for political mobilisation.

item.title: Shah trying to divert attention from real issues, says Vijayan
item.description: “It is in nature of the Union home minister to express his desperation. The country will suffer badly if the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) regime is given another term as it is busy undermining constitutional positions and secular norm,” he said.

item.title: Grand Tamasha: Analysing fine print of this year’s Budget
item.description: While the Budget drew plaudits for both its infrastructure push and fiscal prudence, it was not entirely devoid of electoral signalling.

item.title: Mixed response to former Supreme Court judge S Abdul Nazeer’s appointment as Andhra governor
item.description: New Delhi: The appointment of former Supreme Court judge S Abdul Nazeer as the governor of Andhra Pradesh, within 40 days of his retirement from the top court, on Sunday drew mixed reactions

item.title: Students improved in maths and languages, says TN report
item.description: “ITK centres have therefore emerged as after-school care centres for young children apart from being a place for overcoming learning losses,” the report has found.

item.title: ‘India can have 3.5 million jobs in the renewable energy sector by 2030’
item.description: New Delhi: India’s renewable energy sector can create 3

item.title: Man held for vandalising Muraleedharan’s house
item.description: Days after minister of state for external affairs V Muraleedharan’s house was vandalised here, a man was arrested from Thiruvananthapuram central railway station on Sunday, police said

item.title: Lok Sabha secretariat asks Rahul Gandhi to reply to BJP lawmakers’ notice
item.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been asked to reply to a breach of privilege notice against him by BJP members Pralhad Joshi – who is also the parliamentary affairs minister – and Nishikant Dubey, according to a Lok Sabha official aware of the matter.

item.title: ‘Uncontrolled constructions to affect terrain in west Himalayas’
item.description: Rampant construction, including several hydropower projects, in the sensitive western Himalayan terrain will disturb the ecological balance of the fragile highlands, environmentalist Ravi Chopra said on Sunday.

item.title: Bengaluru university suspends six students for remarks on Ambedkar in skit
item.description: Six students from Jain (deemed-to-be) University in Bengaluru have been suspended for allegedly making offensive remarks against Dr B R Ambedkar and Dalits during a skit earlier this month, varsity officials said.

item.title: Expunging of remarks a new flash point between govt, Opposition
item.description: The Congress’s continued protests against the expunging of remarks made by party president Mallikarjun Kharge and MP Rahul Gandhi highlight a new tension between the Opposition and the government over expunged statements—a process that has not come in for criticism earlier.

item.title: UP Global Investors Summit: Uttar Pradesh capable, ready to play role of India’s growth engine, says President Droupadi Murmu
item.description: According to Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath, the UP Global Investors Summit attracted investment proposals worth ₹33.5 lakh crore

item.title: Woman judge among four elevated as chief justices of high courts
item.description: The Union government on Sunday cleared the appointment of chief justices for four high courts, and paved the way for a woman judge to head the Gujarat high court for the first time since its inception in 1960.

item.title: Spy balloon saga cements rare unity in a divided Washington
item.description: When the United States (US) Senate Foreign Relations Committee (SFRC) convened a hearing on evaluating US’s China policy in an era of strategic competition last week, the tone and tenor of the conversation reflected a rare political and institutional consensus in an otherwise divided America

item.title: PM inaugurates first leg of Delhi-Mumbai e-way
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated the Sohna-Dausa stretch of the Delhi-Mumbai expressway, one of the marquee infrastructure projects of the central government, and hit out at the Congress government in Rajasthan, which he said will benefit from his Bharatiya Janata Party’s push on development

item.title: 12 states, one UT get new governors in major rejig
item.description: The Rashtrapati Bhavan on Sunday announced the appointments of governors to 12 states and the lieutenant governor of the Union territory of Ladakh, in a major gubernatorial rejig that has come ahead of assembly elections in some states and the general elections next year

item.title: North India faces warm spring again, IMD predicts
item.description: Although northwest India will have some respite from the heat till Tuesday on account of strong surface winds, maximum temperatures would then start rising again

item.title: Anti-encroachment drive triggers fear, uncertainty in Jammu and Kashmir
item.description: Hundreds of families, many of them shop owners, have found their names on a list on social media with a warning of demolition.

item.title: India likely to continue curbs on wheat, rice exports
item.description: The government banned wheat exports in May last year as overseas sales from the world’s second-largest producer rose due to the Ukraine war at a time when production fell 2.5% due to a heatwave, straining availability.

item.title: Tripura elections 2023: Only double-engine govt can protect state, says Shah
item.description: Tripura elections 2023: Tripura is faced with the “triple trouble” of the Congress, CPI(M) and TIPRA Motha in the ensuing assembly elections and only a “double engine” government can protect the state, Union home minister Amit Shah said on Sunday.

item.title: Amit Shah's 2019 Srinagar visit gave final touch before 370 abrogation, claims Redt Lt General Dhillon's book
item.description: Amit Shah's June 2019 Srinagar visit was to give final touch before Article 370 abrogation: Retd Lt Gen in book

item.title: Aero India 2023: From Prachand chopper to jetpacks — main attractions
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Bengaluru on Sunday evening to inaugurate the 14th edition of Aero India.

item.title: Smart Cities Mission: 22 cities to be ready by March | Check the list
item.description: Agra, Varanasi and Chennai are among the cities which will mark the completion of the projects under the ambitious mission by next month.

item.title: India’s first frozen lake marathon at Ladakh’s Pangong Tso on Feb 20. Key facts
item.description: Participants from outside Ladakh will have to undergo mandatory acclimatisation, including a three to four days stay in Leh, to overcome high-altitude sickness.

item.title: Daily brief: Rahul Gandhi gets notice over PM-Adani remarks, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: Rahul Gandhi gets notice over 'unparliamentary' remarks on PM Modi over Adani
item.description: Complaints were made against Rahul Gandhi's February 7 parliamentary speech where he alleged that PM Modi was behind the success of Adani Group's owner Gautam Adani.

item.title: Rakhi Sawant's husband accused of raping Iranian woman; FIR filed in Mysuru
item.description: Rakhi Sawant's husband Adil Durrani was arrested on Tuesday night after she filed a complaint accusing him of assault, taking away money and jewellery from her flat without her knowledge and performing unnatural sex, among other charges.

item.title: More weapons may come under import ban, says Rajnath
item.description: The upcoming fifth ‘positive indigenisation list’ will be a pivotal development in India’s quest for self-reliance in defence and will also boost the country’s status as an exporter of military hardware

item.title: Is India prepared to deal with Turkey-like earthquake? Experts answer
item.description: An expert said India is witnessing micro tremors regularly which, in turn, is helping release tectonic stress and offering protection from the possibility of a devastating event.

item.title: Karnataka: Lingayats demand separate religion status, threaten stir
item.description: The Akhila Bharat Lingayata Samanvaya Samiti said they will vote for the political party that comes forward to support their demand.

item.title: PM dedicates Delhi–Dausa–Lalsot section of Delhi Mumbai Expressway to nation
item.description: Highlighting that the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway is powered by the PM Gati Shakti Masterplan, Modi informed that arrangements have been made to lay optical fibre, electricity lines and gas pipelines, and the leftover land will be used for producing solar energy as well as warehousing purposes

item.title: AAP carries out nationwide protest demanding probe in Adani-Hindenburg case
item.description: Demanding a Joint Parliamentary Committee (JPC) probe into the matter, AAP members across the country hit the streets and marched towards BJP headquarters of different states.

item.title: Earthquake of 4 magnitude jolts parts of Assam
item.description: The earthquake was recorded at 4:18 pm, and the epicentre was in Nagaon district on the southern bank of the Brahmaputra river.

item.title: Passenger served 'dusty cornflakes' on Mumbai-Shirdi Vande Bharat train; railway responds
item.description: The passenger called the train "magnificent" and meanwhile listed out the problems like the placement of Executive Class coach and cleaning methods.

item.title: Evening brief: Muslim body chief's ‘Om and Allah’ remark sparks row, and all the latest news
item.description: Here are today’s top news, analysis, and opinion. Know all about the latest news and other news updates from Hindustan Times.

item.title: Former Kerala CM Oommen Chandy airlifted to Bengaluru hospital
item.description: On his way to Bengaluru, 79-year-old Oommen Chandy denied reports appeared in a section of the media that his treatment was delayed by his family members

item.title: BJP will not allow Tripura to be divided: Assam CM on ‘Greater Tipraland’ demand
item.description: During his address at a public gathering in Raishyabari in Tripura's Dhalai district, Sarma talked about the meeting he had with Tipra Motha chief Pradyot Bikram Manikya Deb Barma in Guwahati over the demands of bifurcating Tripura.

item.title: Anusuiya Uikey appointed as new governor of Manipur
item.description: Hailing from Madhya Pradesh, Anusuiya Uikye was the governor of Chhattisgarh prior to becoming the 18th governor of Manipur

item.title: Muslim body chief's ‘Om and Allah’ remark sparks row; angry religious leaders leave stage
item.description: Arshad Madani was speaking during the ongoing annual general session of the Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind at the Ramlila ground in Delhi.
